==Events==
*[[1339]] &ndash; The [[Milan]]ese army and the St. George's (San Giorgio) Mercenaries of [[Lodrisio Visconti]] clashed in the [[Battle of Parabiago]].
*[[1472]] &ndash; [[Orkney]] and [[Shetland]] are [[pawn (law)|pawn]]ed by [[Norway]] to [[Scotland]] in lieu of a [[dowry]] for [[Margaret of Denmark, Queen of Scotland|Margaret of Denmark]].
*[[1547]] &ndash; [[Edward VI of England]] is crowned [[King of England]] at [[Westminster Abbey]].
*[[1685]] &ndash; [[René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle|René-Robert Cavelier]] establishes [[French colonization of Texas|Fort St. Louis]] at [[Matagorda Bay]] thus forming the basis for [[France]]'s claim to [[Texas]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; The [[Postal Service Act]], establishing the [[United States Postal Service|United States Post Office Department]], is signed by [[President of the United States|President]] [[George Washington]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Louis Alexandre Berthier]] removes [[Pope Pius VI]] from power.
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[Andreas Hofer]], [[German Tyrol|Tirol]]ean [[Patriotism|patriot]] and leader of [[rebellion]] against [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]]'s forces, is [[execution (legal)|executed]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[Manuel Belgrano]] defeats the [[Royalist (Spanish American Revolution)|royalist]] army of [[Pío de Tristán]] during the [[Battle of Salta]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; [[Gioachino Rossini|Rossini's]] opera ''[[The Barber of Seville]]'' premieres at the [[Teatro Argentina]] in [[Rome]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; [[Concepción, Chile]] is destroyed by an [[earthquake]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; Polish insurgents lead an [[Kraków Uprising|uprising in Kraków]] to incite a fight for national independence.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Olustee]] occurs &ndash; the largest battle fought in [[Florida]] during the war.
*[[1865]] &ndash; End of the [[Uruguayan War]], with a peace agreement between President [[Tomás Villalba]] and rebel leader [[Venancio Flores]], setting the scene for the destructive [[Paraguayan War|War of the Triple Alliance]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; In [[New York City]] the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]] opens.
*[[1873]] &ndash; The [[University of California]] opens its first [[medical school]] in [[San Francisco, California]].
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky|Tchaikovsky]]'s [[ballet]] ''[[Swan Lake]]'' receives its première performance at the [[Bolshoi Theatre]] in [[Moscow]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; The legislature of [[Territory of Hawaii|Hawaii Territory]] convenes for the first time.
*[[1909]] &ndash; Publication of the [[Futurist Manifesto]] in the French journal [[Le Figaro]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[King O'Malley]] drives in the first [[Surveying|survey]] peg to mark commencement of work on the construction of [[Canberra]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The [[Young Communist League of Czechoslovakia]] is founded.
*[[1931]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States]] approves the construction of the [[San Francisco – Oakland Bay Bridge]] by the state of [[California]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; The Congress of the United States proposes the [[Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution]] that will end [[Prohibition in the United States]].
*  1933   &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] [[Secret Meeting of 20 February 1933|secretly meets]] with German industrialists to arrange for financing of the [[Nazi Party]]'s upcoming election campaign.
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Caroline Mikkelsen]] becomes the first woman to set foot in [[Antarctica]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; Lieutenant [[Edward O'Hare]] becomes America's first [[World War II]] [[flying ace]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; American [[movie studio]] executives agree to allow the [[Office of War Information]] to [[Censorship|censor]] movies.
*  1943   &ndash; The [[Parícutin]] volcano begins to form in Parícutin, [[Mexico]].
*  1943   &ndash; ''[[The Saturday Evening Post]]'' publishes the first of [[Norman Rockwell]]'s ''[[Four Freedoms (Norman Rockwell)|Four Freedoms]]'' in support of [[United States President]] [[Franklin Roosevelt]]'s 1941 [[State of the Union address]] theme of [[Four Freedoms]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The "[[Big Week]]" began with American bomber raids on [[Germany|German]] [[aircraft]] manufacturing centers.
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: The [[United States]] takes [[Eniwetok]] Island.
*[[1952]] &ndash; [[Emmett Ashford]] becomes the first [[African-American]] [[umpire (baseball)|umpire]] in organized [[baseball]] by being authorized to be a substitute umpire in the Southwestern International League.
*[[1956]] &ndash; The [[United States Merchant Marine Academy]] becomes a permanent Service Academy.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Avro Arrow]] program to design and manufacture [[supersonic]] [[fighter aircraft|jet fighters]] in [[Canada]] is cancelled by the [[John George Diefenbaker|Diefenbaker]] government amid much political debate.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Mercury program]]: While aboard [[Mercury Atlas 6|Friendship 7]], [[John Glenn]] becomes the first American to orbit the [[earth]], making three orbits in 4 hours, 55 minutes.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Ranger 8]] crashes into the [[moon]] after a successful mission of photographing possible landing sites for the [[Apollo program]] [[astronaut]]s.
*[[1971]] &ndash; The United States [[Emergency Broadcast System]] is accidentally activated in an erroneous national alert.
*[[1978]] &ndash; The last [[Order of Victory]] is bestowed upon [[Leonid Brezhnev]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] launches its [[Mir]] spacecraft. Remaining in orbit for 15 years, it is occupied for 10 of those years.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Unabomber]]: In [[Salt Lake City]], a bomb explodes in a [[computer]] store.
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast]] votes to secede from [[Azerbaijan]] and join [[Armenia]], triggering the [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; An [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|IRA]] bomb destroys a section of a [[British Army]] barracks in [[Ternhill]], [[England]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; A gigantic statue of [[Albania]]'s long-time leader, [[Enver Hoxha]], is brought down in the Albanian capital [[Tirana]], by mobs of angry protesters.
*[[1998]] &ndash; American figure skater [[Tara Lipinski]] becomes the youngest gold-medalist at the [[Winter Olympics]] in [[Nagano, Japan]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; During a [[Great White]] [[concert]] in [[West Warwick, Rhode Island|West Warwick]], [[Rhode Island]], a [[pyrotechnics]] display [[The Station nightclub fire|sets the Station nightclub ablaze]], killing 100 and injuring over 200 others.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Spain]] becomes the first country to vote in a [[Spanish referendum on the Treaty establishing a Constitution for Europe|referendum on ratification]] of the [[Treaty establishing a Constitution for Europe|proposed Constitution]] of the [[European Union]], passing it by a substantial margin, but on a low turnout.
*[[2006]] &ndash; In [[South Korea]] the [[United Liberal Democrats]], [[Political parties in South Korea|the three top political parties]] was merged into [[Saenuri Party|Grand National Party]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[2009 suicide air raid on Colombo|Two Tamil Tigers aircraft packed with C4 explosives]] en route to the national airforce headquarters are shot down by the Sri Lankan military before reaching their target, in a [[kamikaze]] style attack.
*[[2010]] &ndash; In Madeira Island, Portugal, heavy rain causes [[2010 Madeira floods and mudslides|floods and mudslides]], resulting in at least 43 deaths, in the worst disaster in the [[history of Madeira|history of the archipelago]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; The smallest [[Extrasolar planet]], [[Kepler-37b]] is discovered.
